item.title: Kevin Mitnick has died
item.description: - Renowned cybersecurity expert Kevin Mitnick has passed away after a battle with pancreatic cancer.

item.title: Stanford president resigns over manipulated research, will retract 3 papers
item.description: - Stanford President Marc Tessier-Lavigne will resign and retract or issue corrections to at least three papers due to manipulated research data.

item.title: Advanced Python Mastery
item.description: - 'Advanced Python Mastery' is an exercise-driven course on advanced Python programming written by David Beazley, a renowned author in the field.

item.title: Children of alumni no longer have admissions edge at Carnegie Mellon, Pitt
item.description: - Carnegie Mellon University and the University of Pittsburgh have decided to no longer give preferential treatment to students who have family members who attended the schools, known as legacies.

item.title: ASUS to manufacture & sell Intel's NUC products
item.description: - Intel has agreed to a partnership with ASUS, a technology solution provider, to manufacture, sell, and support Intel's Next Unit of Compute (NUC) systems product line.

item.title: Senators to Propose Ban on U.S. Lawmakers, Executive Branch Members Owning Stock
Bookwyrm – A federated social network for reading books
item.description: - BookWyrm is a collaborative software that helps people share and discuss books.

item.title: Launch HN: Twenty.com (YC S23) – Open-source CRM
item.description: - The post is about the launch of Twenty.com, an open-source CRM (Customer Relationship Management) software.

item.title: Netscape & Sun announce JavaScript (1995)
item.description: - Netscape and Sun Microsystems announced the release of JavaScript, an open, cross-platform object scripting language for creating and customizing applications on enterprise networks and the Internet.

item.title: A glitch in the SEO matrix
item.description: - A glitch in the SEO matrix has been discovered where a specific keyword related to open-source software for big data management is generating a high volume of searches but has limited content to match.
